profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:23:52 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding the preparation of Reese's book "American Prize Prints of the 20th Century" (1949), mainly soliciting biographical information and information about specific art works. Some of the artists responded with detailed information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondents include Ivan Albright, Grace Albee, James Allen, Niels Yde Anderson, Frank H. Anderson, Grant Arnold, William Auerbach-Levy, Peggy Bacon, Maxil Ballinger, Albert W. Barker, Will Barnet, Lawrence Barrett, T. Bengty, Frank W. Benson, Thomas H. Benton, Bernece Berkman-Hunter, Ray Bethers, Gross Bettelheim, George Biddle, Richard E. Bishop, Isabel Bishop, Lucile Blanch, Julius Bloch, Aaron Bohrod, Mortimer Borne, Cornelis Botke, Fiske Boyd, Helen K. Boyer, Theodore Brenson, Syd Browne, Conrad Buff, Cecil Buller, Paul Cadmus, Harrison Cady, Letterio Calapai, Samuel Chamberlain, Jean Charlot, Asa Cheffety, Philip Cheney, Howard Cook, John E. Costigan,Alan Crane, Stephen Csoka, Lewis Daniel, E. Hubert Deines, John de Martelly, Inez Demonet, Frederick Detwiller, Caroline Durieux, Philip Evergood, Fritz Eichenberg, Ralph Fabri, R. Vale Faro, Ernest Fiene, Issac Freiedlander, Sue Fuller, Michael Gallagher, Sears Gallagher, Gerald Geerlings, Todros Geller, Harold Geyer, Douglas Gorsline, Gordon Grant, Marion Greenwood, William Gropper,

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 1393 and 1394 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Albert Reese was a writer and teacher from New York City.
